forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain showers before 4pm. Partly sunny. High near 56, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. West northwest wind around 18 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 47. West northwest wind 10 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph.

weather_report:
The current conditions in Downtown San Francisco usher in a brisk afternoon, marked by a hint of uncertainty sprinkled with the charm of city life. The clouds, while partially playful in their drift, allow patches of sunlight to break through, illuminating the iconic skyline. Despite a subtle threat of rain showers lingering until the early afternoon, the air remains fresh and refreshing, resonating with autumnal whispers. A notable breeze from the west-northwest dances at about 18 mph, accentuating the chill in the atmosphere, while the temperature hovers around the mid-fifties, gradually descending as the day progresses.

As night approaches, the clouds will recede into an expansive canvas of darkness, with only the silhouette of the city standing resolutely against a backdrop of stars. For those venturing out this evening, layering should be the approach; a light jacket paired with a comfortable scarf offers just enough reprieve against the cool air that will settle around 47 degrees. This is a perfect opportunity to wrap up the day with a quiet stroll along the Embarcadero or to seek warmth at a local café, savoring the soothing aroma of freshly brewed coffee as you watch the city wind down. The ambiance is suited for introspection, casual conversation, or simply taking in the beauty of a city that feels alive under the night sky.
